title: Understanding Logarithm Functions
text: Logarithmic functions, such as $$\ln(x)$$, are only defined for positive values of $$x$$. This means the expression inside the log function must be greater than zero.

title: Analyzing the Expression Inside the Logarithm
text: For the function $$f(x)=\ln(x-\frac{3}{7})$$, focus on the expression $$x-\frac{3}{7}$$. To maintain the domain of the function, this expression must be greater than zero.

title: Determining the Domain
text: To solve for the domain, find the values of $$x$$ for which $$x-\frac{3}{7}>0$$. Solve this inequality. Please enter your answer as $$x>a$$ where a is the solution to the equation.

title: Understanding Vertical Asymptotes
text: A vertical asymptote occurs where the function becomes undefined or approaches $$\infty$$. For logarithmic functions, vertical asymptotes appear where the expression inside the log function equals zero.

title: Finding the Vertical Asymptote
text: To determine the vertical asymptote, identify the x-value that makes $$x-\frac{3}{7}$$ equal to zero. Please enter your answer in the form $$x=a$$ where a is the solution.
